page.title: 05Watford: Odhams-Sun Printers
page.content: In 1919 a company called Sun Engraving was set up in Whippendell Road. They printed magazines with four colour illustrations. They had taken over the premises of G.W.Jones Ltd. who had built the factory in 1906. Today the factory is on the same site but has extended over 6 acres. Since 1919 the Sun Printers has produced the firstall gravure weekly "Picturegoer" delivered complete from the machine and in 1938 "Picture Post"became the first million circulation weekly. Today they print Woman's Own, Sunday Times Magazine, The Mail On Sunday, Woman's Weekly and T.V.Times. In 1981 2 Cennuit presses were installed costing Â£2 million pounds each. In 1981 the company was bought by Robert Maxwell and became Odhams-Sun Printers.
